texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: DISA's final release of the Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7 Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG)  came out a few weeks ago  and it has plenty of improvements and changes. The openstack-ansible-security role has already been updated with these changes.
texts.text: DISA's final release of the Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7 Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG)  came out a few weeks ago  and it has plenty of improvements and changes. The openstack-ansible-security role has already been updated with these changes.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Quite a few duplicated STIG controls were removed and a few new ones were added. Some of the controls in the pre-release were difficult to implement, especially those that changed parameters for PKI-based authentication.
texts.text: Quite a few duplicated STIG controls were removed and a few new ones were added. Some of the controls in the pre-release were difficult to implement, especially those that changed parameters for PKI-based authentication.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The biggest challenge overall was the renumbering. The pre-release STIG used an unusual numbering convention: RHEL-07-123456. The final version used the more standardized "V" numbers, such as V-72225. This change required a  substantial patch  to bring the Ansible role inline with the new STIG release.
texts.text: The biggest challenge overall was the renumbering. The pre-release STIG used an unusual numbering convention: RHEL-07-123456. The final version used the more standardized "V" numbers, such as V-72225. This change required a  substantial patch  to bring the Ansible role inline with the new STIG release.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: All of the  role's documentation  is now updated to reflect the new numbering scheme and STIG changes. The key thing to remember is that you'll need to use
texts.text: All of the  role's documentation  is now updated to reflect the new numbering scheme and STIG changes. The key thing to remember is that you'll need to use

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: with the new STIG numbers if you need to skip certain tasks.
texts.text: with the new STIG numbers if you need to skip certain tasks.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Note:  These changes won't be backported to the
texts.text: Note:  These changes won't be backported to the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: branch, so you need to use the
texts.text: branch, so you need to use the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Have feedback? Found a bug? Let us know!
texts.text: Have feedback? Found a bug? Let us know!
